sentences.english: They look at the clouds, retreating.
Softly touch your knee to the floor when stepping back into the half-kneeling position.
sentences.chinese: 向后撤步至单膝下跪姿态时，膝部应和地面轻轻接触。

sentences.english: Their troops recoiled before the attack of the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 他们的部队迫于敌人的进攻而后撤。

sentences.english: Su Chu overseas Chinese people are no longer latent, mixed among the Japanese soldiers to retreat.
sentences.chinese: 苏楚侨等人不再潜伏，混在日军士兵中间后撤。

sentences.english: Our troops recoiled before the attack.
sentences.chinese: 我部队迫于敌人的进攻而后撤。

sentences.english: Gradually, forwards began to drop deeper.
The enemy's army retreated about 50-odd miles, which made our army gain vantage ground.
sentences.chinese: 敌军的部队后撤了50余里，使我军获得了有利地形。

sentences.english: They quickly retreat back to Ono Naotake report.
sentences.chinese: 他们赶紧后撤回来报告给小野尚武。

definition: to recoil/to draw back/to fall back/to retreat
to retreat and defend/to withdraw and maintain one's guard
to face an attack/to repulse the enemy
to advance on sth/to press closely (on some goal)
to flee in disorder/defeated and in rout
to stop/to obstruct/to bar the way
